examples: You have to be in it to win it — that's my motto .

definitions.definition: A sentence, phrase, or word, forming part of an heraldic achievement .
A sentence , phrase , or word , prefixed to an essay , discourse , chapter , canto , or the like, suggestive of its subject matter; a short, suggestive expression of a guiding principle ; a maxim .
A paper packet containing a sweetmeat, cracker, etc., together with a scrap of paper bearing a motto.

secondary_definitions: ( heraldry ) A sentence, phrase, or word, forming part of an heraldic achievement .
A sentence , phrase , or word , prefixed to an essay , discourse , chapter , canto , or the like, suggestive of its subject matter; a short, suggestive expression of a guiding principle ; a maxim .
( obsolete ) A paper packet containing a sweetmeat, cracker, etc., together with a scrap of paper bearing a motto.
